We can only hope everyone who visits here enjoys it as much as we do.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was our first airbnb. We cannot say enough about our visit. The place is so spectacular! Super clean and so many little extras such as little treats, some soft drinks and bottled water in the fridge, assorted chips, and even a s'mores kit for the fire pit out back. The firepit had four chairs and was well stocked with wood and all accessories to have a camp fire. We had plenty of privacy but Ben and his mother were available when we needed them. We had fun meeting their two dogs, Bella and Cash and Rosie the horse. For us, the place was like a small paradise. Can't say enough about Ben and his mother's hospitality. The are both wonderful people. The house had everything and more than we expected. We are from Tempe, Arizona and went back to have a small family reunion in Rockford, but after our stay we plan go back to Ben's place every year for a vacation because we enjoyed ourselves that much!

review_text: Ben's place is lovely! The setting is just gorgeous - open fields and farmland as far as you can see - and the guest house is charming and very comfortable. Ben supplied a full-height queen size air mattress that our daughter slept on, which was comfortable, and the place was plenty roomy for the three of us. The little back deck was a sweet place to have our morning coffee and granola bar (found in a basket of snacks that Ben has out for guests, along with the awesome s'mores fixings that others have mentioned). Ben and his mom are super friendly and hospitable and very quick to respond to any requests. We got to meet their two adorable dogs, their horse, and a good number of barn cats, which was a bonus! If we are passing through this part of the country again, we'll hope to stay at Ben's place.

review_text: My husband and I stayed at Ben's place to avoid overcrowding with family at Lake Summerset over a long week-end, and this location was ideal for that - less than 10 minutes away. Because we left in the morning and didn't return until evening, we didn't wander the grounds here, but we found the accommodations spacious and very clean, we appreciated the treats as well as the drinks in the frig,and Ben answered any questions we had within minutes. I'd like to note that the accessible (larger) bathroom is attached to the bedroom, which is a convenience that may not be clear from the pictures. There are two closets in the bedroom, so plenty of room to unpack if you were here for a longer stay. We would definitely return.

name: Jordan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
The cutest little house ever! The location is perfect and close to everything in Freeport. Finding it was easy and parking was available in the alley or out on the street. Everything inside was very clean and comfortable.
The kitchen was well stocked with cooking utensils if you choose to cook there and host provided coffee pods, tea bags, and even a French press for those who prefer to go that route. Beds were comfortable and rooms were dark at night, no outside light filtered in. Each bedroom had a dresser and a walk in closet so bags weren't taking up room in the bedroom. Bathroom was well stocked as well. Living room was spacious and comfortable and was a nice place to chill out after a busy day.
The house is beautiful inside and out. I loved the built-ins and all of the wood work. It encompassed so much of the beautiful old houses in Freeport. So much character! I personally loved how it was decorated with all of its nods to Freeport history.
Host was accommodating, was available when I had questions and very nice to chat with. We will definitely recommend this place to anyone who visits Freeport and will be sure to try to stay here again next time we visit! One of the best experiences of our little Freeport visit.

review_text:
This is a lovely home in a quiet, conveniently-located area. Check-in was simple and there was plenty of easy parking. Stephen was a kind and communicative host, and he even offered to let me check in early. Lots of thoughtful little touches like local snack-foods, a brand new kitchen sponge still in the packaging, and a nice selection of teas enhanced my stay.
One thing prospective guests should be aware of is that this is a very highly scented home: plug-in air fresheners, bedding and towels washed with heavily-fragranced laundry products, the strong smell of something like Febreze in the living area, etc. Some guests may enjoy this! But for anyone who suffers from allergies, migraines, or other sensitivities to fragrances, this is definitely something you'll want to consider before booking. (Also, while this home has many beautiful large windows that fill the house with lovely natural light, unfortunately, most of the windows cannot be opened, so airing out the house is difficult.)

,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text: My family and I booked this Airbnb on the spare of the moment to visit my terminally ill mom who had taken a turn for the worst. Despite it being a typical gray Mid-West winter the Airbnb offered a very light and airy feel that helped lifted our spirits during challenging times. Although we experienced a black out (due to a winter storm, the house is well insulated and the heat was plentiful before the storm so the house stayed comfortably warm until ComEd was able to restore power. Stephen provided us a nice gift card to Apple Bees for our inconvenience as well as offered us an additional day of stay as a gift to my family (checking out Dec 26th vs our original day of Dec 25th) which helped tremendously as my mom passed on December 20th and we had no concrete plans for Christmas. My family and I loved the Airbnb and are grateful for Stephen's hospitality. We would absolutely stay here again!

The local area has great parks and hiking opportunities- we really enjoyed the Nachusa Grasslands and White Pines Forest State Park and look forward to checking out Castle Rock State Park when we return!

Well we are just head over heels for this spot and the postcard perfect town of Oregon, IL!
We enjoyed laying in the yard birding (bring your good binoculars!) and reading so much, we only left the property to go tubing one day (highly recommended, through White Pelican!)
We cooked a ton with a plenty stocked kitchen and enjoyed the fire pit.
On our way out of town we stopped at the amazing Flamingo Palace antique shop and a few other surrounding stores.
We are already thinking of coming again to explore hiking and cooler temps!
The house was clean, comfortable, and with the greenery filled in, so secluded! I feel like it was better than the photos which seem to be mostly taken in winter. We prioritized our time outside. We donâ€™t mind a little May Flies in our June though- this is riverside country chillinâ€™ and if you hate nature, get lost! None of the bugs were biting, youâ€™ll be fine.
Book it quick, City Slicker! (Oh! Donâ€™t forget to flip through the photo album itâ€™s amazing!)

The view from the sunroom is so beautiful. The decor and view give the cabin a very peaceful and relaxing vibe. The only bad part was the bugs. At least to a city girl, they're huge and there are so many. Because of the bugs we mostly stayed inside but we still enjoyed our stay so much. On the last day it was much cooler and there were very few bugs. Would love to come back again in the fall or winter. Heather is also a great host! She provided a brochure prior to our stay that had directions, a breakdown of what to expect in each room, things to do nearby, check out rules, etc. It had a ton of great information in it. She also checked in with us throughout our stay and was ready to help whenever needed. Thank you, Heather!

review_text: I would definitely book this again. Everything inside and out well taken care of. No shabby furniture, towels, pillows or linens. Plenty of kitchen utensils and dinnerware. Kitchen is a walk-through galley that is tiny. We found the bar in the main living area where we socialized and ate. We did only breakfast at the cabin so for us the kitchen was very adequate. The only thing that would be helpful for others would be a dishwasher but cabin is on septic. We would recommend guests think about disposable dinnerware. Bathroom very nice. Open sleeping area with two small twins fitted under slanted roof would be a tight sleeping arrangement for larger adults. or adults wishing more privacy in sleeping quarters. This open sleeping area adjoins the bedroom with sliding doors. Pictures in the listing are accurate and give a guest a good look at the entire layout and arrangements. Hot tub is BIG and was fun. The wrap around deck will be wonderful in warmer weather. Great hosts!

We brought our family of six and enjoyed everything about our stay: Hiking the mowed paths in the forest/grasslands, fires under the beautiful star filled skies, evening dips in the hot tub, playing sports in the beautiful grass field and hiking down to the pond to fish and walk around. Some might be hesitant because the cabin is connected to the main house but let me tell you there's no feeling of "shared" space. You get the enjoy the property unbothered. That said, when we did walk around to see the animals and the rest of the farm Dan, Kellie and their family couldn't have been more welcoming to us. We can't wait to come back when the veggies and berries are ready for harvest!

The swing, the fire pit, wrap around patio, the hot tub, and even a little wood platform to do yoga! We couldn't ask for anything more. Our dog loves to play fetch, and it was like heaven for him. He was very disappointed when he saw that we drove home...no joke! Needless to say, we hope to have another vacation at Highview Country Escape soon.

This was one of the most incredible vacations we have ever had! Dan and Kellie were very personable and wonderful to work with. The cabin is a DREAM! It was beautifully decorated and wonderfully comfortable; especially the thoughtful touches like lighting, multi-use architecture, and plethora of comfort items. It had almost everything we needed and when we wanted a specialized kitchen tool that wasn't stocked, Kellie and Dan let us borrow it from their home! Grocery was down the street, trails on the property to hike around, and even a farm stand at the beginning of their property. The hot tub, scenery, and amenities of the cabin were outstanding. My partner and I repeatedly remarked that we felt like we were in our own Eden staying there. Our pup loved it too! It was enjoyable when it was sunny and rainy as the windows made you feel a part of the surrounding nature whatever the climate. (Pro tips- bring candles! It is so magical at night when lit by candles. And, place your portable speaker on the second floor towards the railing to bathe the home in music!) We will definitely be back next time we need an escape from the world. 10/10 would highly recommend!! THANK YOU for letting us recharge in your lovely space and being so lovely to work with <3
(Shout out to Mike's Engine Works! They had easy and affordable ATV rentals with over 100 miles of trails! It was only 30 minutes from the cabin)

The views from this rental are absolutely amazing, the pictures truly donâ€™t do it justice. We were pleasantly surprised to be on top of a hill and be able to see miles of rolling farmland in every direction.
The property is perfectly secluded and has everything you need for a perfect weekend away. The cabin itself has a ton of great features - ample fridge space, plenty of seating, a grill, a fire pit, a covered patio furniture set, and of course the hot tub! The hot tub provided the perfect view of the sunset between the trees and of the stars above.
Our dog loved running around in the grass and was very disappointed on Sunday when he realized that this was not a permanent move.
Kellie and Dan were great hosts! They were very responsive to all of our questions and left very detailed instructions for check in and check out procedures. We would love to make this an annual trip.

Absolutely wonderful cabin and location. We were looking to get away over the 4th of July and this place was everything we were looking for and more. You can feel the love and care that Dan and Kellie put into their place. The cabin is clean, stylish, and very comfortable. The view from the cabin is breathtaking. I do not think I would ever get tired of sitting out by the fire on the top of the hill. If you are looking to get away from the city this place is perfect!
Our kids also loved the hot tub as well as access to Apple Canyon Lake. Because of Covid you had to make a reservation to go to the lake or pool at Apple Canyon and could only stay for 90 minutes. I am happy that the association is doing that because it made it very easy to social distant at both the beach and pool. The lake and pool are both very very nice. Dan was great about making reservations for us. If not for Covid you would have unlimited access to the pool and beach, so if you are reading this after Covid (hopefully not too long in the future) all the better!
All in all I cannot say enough good things about this place. We hope to come back again in the future!

Once you are there you donâ€™t have to leave for anything the full kitchen has everything you need, tasteful touches include the beer and wine cooler, and super awesome lighted counter in the main area.

So I say again, if you are a nature person youâ€™re gonna love this place, if youâ€™re looking to get away from the bustling city life youâ€™re gonna love this place, if youâ€™re just looking for a trip to just relax youâ€™re gonna love this place.

review_text:
The place was exactly as described and pictured on the website. Staying there I found many extras that made it an extra comfortable stay. In the Master Bedroom there were nightstands on either side of the king sized bed. Each nightstand contained: 1) Lights that when touched turned on a low, medium then high light then back to off. So easy to get the right light level. 2) A plug in for charging your phone. 3) A coaster for a glass or plastic bottle. 4) One of the nightstands contained a clock with large numbers and it also projected the time on the ceiling. Very convenient! And the bed had a heated mattress pad. When I was in Freeport it was cold, and getting into heated sheets was a treat!
The Master Bedroom also includes: 1) a very large closet, 2) a nice sized desk with a lamp and an installed plug-in. I used the desk to plug in my lighted make-up mirror and apply my make-up. Again, so convient! 3) A large flat screen TV.
Everything was clean & comfortable. Just wonderful!

Frank and Moonyean deserve 7 stars! This place is truly a gem - very high quality. Large, well-appointed, clean, cared for (everything looks new), and comes with all you would need and more. The beds are super-comfortable and it is so rare to have a full-sized laundry room for free use.
I needed to work during the days and there was a nice desk area that is quiet and separate from the main living/dining room. The Wi-Fi was solid and speedy. Going out at night was easy with automatic lights along the path and no stairs to navigate.
Finally, we had the opportunity to meet Frank and Moonyean and they are wonderfully kind people. So good to know my childhood hometown still has great residents to continue its legacy.

It was on mother's day with my mom and we had an amazing time. The 2nd time I was there. I brought my husband and my two kids and we also had an amazing time. (Us and the kids genuinely love playing with the dogs and the cat. That goes for all three visits). And this third visit was a daughter and daddy get away. My dad can't walk too well these days and their thoughtfulness really helped us have an amazing time. I've always visited in spring and am looking forward to a fall visit.

,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Everything about my solo stay at Westhaven (for 10 days, with my pup) was exactly what I needed & was hoping for. The surroundings are so serene, the trails are gorgeous (even in the winter!), & Jilly and Kenbob were the absolute best.
Westhaven was exactly as described -- the internet was great for everything except for video calls, I had to take those from my phone (for some reason, Verizon cell service worked better for Microsoft Teams than the wifi, but I work in IT & the wifi didn't give me any other problems), the shower was great, the water was hot, the bed was comfy, and I loved that there was a grill in addition to the hot plate (and electric tea kettle, toaster oven, coffee maker!).
Not only were Jilly and Kenbob incredibly kind and wonderful to chat with (and their dogs are the hecking sweetest), I had a safety concern about the door when I got there, and they didn't bat an eyelash figuring out a solution.
Thank you for making sure that Cricket and I had the best time!

Stayed one night
review_text: This was our 2nd stay here. It's an unusual location, a repurposed farm building on a working farm (no animals except their dogs). It's fairly close to Freeport, IL, just a couple miles away but on a quiet road and down a long gravel driveway, nestled in the rolling farmland and woods of the area, with no noise or lights to disturb us. Freeport is a funny little city, small but with plenty of amenities, and cheap too! We stayed one night, on New Year's Day, and stayed in, reading and relaxing mostly, but last time we were here we took a long walk on the property with Jilly and Kenbob (long-ish, for us, I'm told Jilly's walks can cover 5-9 miles). On our 2nd stay we saw they had added several new interesting features to the place. The bed and furniture were comfortable, the kitchen and bathroom were fantastic, the heating worked very well, and there must be 100 interesting and decorative features around the apartment. We will return again soon.

name: Karen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
â™¡â™¡â™¡ Jilly & her husband have poured their heart & soul into a beautiful place nestled in the countryside that they call Westhaven. When you find the driveway, just take a momemt to pause at the end and think about relaxing from that moment on.
Take in the beauty as you meander down the long driveway which crosses over a creek & eventually brings you to your lovely accommodations. Upon arrival you'll admire the unique barn-type structure you'll be hanging out in. The full, open concept studio-type living quarters is VERY inviting! Just like the pictures, it has an eclectic rustic style that instantly makes you feel warm & fuzzy. It seems if you need anything...just ASK! (They say that phrase often in their very well put together "welcome book")
They have thought of everything...even down to the handy fire extinguisher perfectly located & visible right next to an exit door and in close proximity to the kitchen! â™¡ Let's hope no one EVER has to use it! :) They have a well stocked kitchen including a toaster oven, hot & cold water dispenser, 2 burner stove, small refrigerator w/ a small freezer, BBQ grill & microwave. Also included are pots and pans, plates, wine glasses, mugs, cooking utensils, forks/knives/spoons, baggies, aluminum foil, etc, etc, etc! Oh! And it's help yourself to spices, hot cocoa, S&P & whatever else is available to eat.
The bathroom is spacious & has a cozy feeling with it's rustic wood decor. This room also has all the "goodies" you need (toothpaste, shampoo, etc) in case you forget something from home.
There are very nice porches on both sides of the building. One side has a few chairs and an amazing overlook of beautiful farm land, the other side has a BBQ grill & a table and chairs for those long, warm, beautiful spring, summer or fall days and nights.
If you're pondering this place DO NOT HESITATE!! I learned they are booked up most available days. I'm lucky I found this gem & can't wait to go back. It truly feels like a slice of country heaven. â™¡

My husband and I were visiting from Arizona and had the pleasure of staying at Westhaven (Cozy Country Home) for 6 nights.
Jilly and Ken-Bob, are very personable (along with their friendly dogs, Axel and Cujo)! They personally greeted us at check-in and check-out. They give us space but also were easy to contact and checked in to see how we were doing in a very welcoming and friendly manner. Canâ€™t say enough about their personalities! As the sign in their home says, "Enter As Strangers Leave as Friends" :)
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay; it was perfect from the beginning of booking to check-out. We would recommend staying here and are looking forward to our next visit back to Freeport! Thank you, for sharing your cozy country home and making our stay memorable. Bill and Vicki
PS: A binder is provided with details on the house, suggestions of things to do, and history about the area that is very helpful. The home offers many amenities â€“ interesting dÃ©cor, comfy bedding, a thermostat to set at your liking, the bathroom had toiletry items and a nice hot shower, the kitchen had cooking options, coffee, tea, oatmeal, popcorn, etc. Outside thereâ€™s a little deck with a grill, if you feel adventurous, there are lots of trails and water options to explore (we enjoyed inside and outdoors with our grandchildren).

review_text: Repeat renter here. This is our second time renting here and it won't be our last. Rental is amazing in every way. The place is clean and everything has been done with a lot of creativity and mindfulness. Jill and Ken Bob are amazing renters is and amazing people. They really make you feel at home and welcomed. Both dogs and cats were so much fun to be around. There are plenty of trails to walk and nature to see. They even let us up a really nice big bonfire for the evening for me my husband and my two kids. It was something like we would never see where we live lol. crepe park nearby is also an amazing place to go whether you are alone, a couple or a family with kids. If you go between May 29th and April 15th you will find a lot of fun things open for the kids to do there. Of course there's a lot to do there the rest of the year as well. The town has everything you need within reach as far as grocery shopping and food. We the Family Affair Diner, Logan's and Route 73 Brew and Chew. Honestly I can't keep going on and on... Looking forward to coming back again for our first time in the Summer with the kids.

review_text: Rogers place was perfect for our family. Plenty to do for adults and kids ranging from 4 to 9 years old, and plenty of space inside and out to do it. Check in was a breeze, the house was perfectly clean. The house was full of things to do- smart TVs, board games, books, a puppet theater, ping pong and a piano. Tons of outdoor and lake things as well. We enjoyed the kayaks, paddle boats and fishing from the pier. The fire pit was great and stocked with wood. We especially loved the deck and lounging on the daybed overlooking the peaceful and quiet lake. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we could possibly need. Roger was an awesome communicator, he answered every message I sent within minutes, and checked in on us to make sure everything was to our liking. He gave good recommendations for food and was an all around great host. Thanks for letting us stay!

review_text:
A peaceful retreat! If you appreciate a lovely (yet homey and comfortable) living space, a well appointed and stocked kitchen(i.e. pots, pans, spices, essential small appliances, coffee, even a community cupboard) we highly recommend you stay at Roger's place!
Fun for a family but would also be great for an anniversary getaway.
There were 8 of us...4 adults,4 kiddos.
We swam(towels provided, even a few floaties/loungers)....but it is a small lake,so recommend water shoes (I wore them but not everyone in our group did) and rinsing off when you get out. There are also two kayaks and two paddle boards that got good use by the kids(9,13,14,15).
Fish were caught(I think I heard catfish and one bluegill), ping pong was played, along with a fun for us baby grand piano!
Rain??There are loads of games provided as well as a fun little puppet show 'stage' and a bunch of awesome puppets for the littles.
Roger is the epitome of a great host...hospitable, responsive and kind.
Thanks, Roger!

review_text: This was one of the best trips and stays we have taken as a family. Not only did we have an experience of a lifetime but we also got to enjoy the beauty and soul of a what seems like a quickly fleeing gem of a way of life in America, a small generational family farm. Dan and Ashley were responsive, kind and more than accommodating. The home is spacious and clean. I highly recommend the horse riding experience. Dan is a genuine expert and you can tell his love for the animals in everything he says and does. We will be back to see you all very soon!

review_text:
We are so grateful to Dan and Ashley for hosting our family vacation!
We comfortably stayed in a clean and welcoming home with the 7 of us (my in-laws/sister-in-law and son, and my family (myself, my husband/son)) and everyone had plenty of space. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were clean (I would recommend a mat on the shower for a less slippery bath for kiddos!), and the space was open. The lower level floors were heated - which was extra nice in the crisp mornings. It was great too that there was a playset outside with swings/a slide!
The FARM was the best part about our stay, of course. We all loved the interactive farm tour, the pony rides/grooming for the kiddos, and just exploring about (especially when Toby was around - the golden retriever!). Three adults enjoyed the trail ride - it was beautiful scenery and wonderful bonding with the horses.
This really is a special place. We look forward to planning a return trip :)

review_text:
Staying at the Dairy Farm is a delightful experience that I wish everyone could enjoy. The house is very comfortable and clean and Ashley provided a basketful of local goodies including fresh farm eggs.
Dan provided a great tour, explaining what the state of family farming is today. We loved meeting the horses, cats, Toby the farm dog, cows and pigs - all pretty friendly!
The house was quite well equipped with comfortable beds and lots of thoughtful details throughout the common areas. The kitchen had lots of dishes and glassware, dishwasher and a big refrigerator. Nice quality pots, pans and serving bowls were provided.
Overall, we plan to return as soon as possible!

review_text: This place far exceeded our expectations. We have stayed to many places but this is our all time favourite. We were there for the weekend in the middle of April with 6 kids, all under 10 years of age. We did the farm tour. The kids did the pony rides, and the adults were able to ride horses. The house is super comfortable and cozy. Ashley is incredibly thoughtful; there was nothing that was missing in the house, and we were touched by every small detail: from welcoming gifts of local products, to fully stocked kitchen (including fresh eggs), all type of sport equipments for kids and adults, classic books and movie collection. Dan gave us the tour of the farm and horse lessons. He was extremely generous with his time and our inquiries. We learned a lot about farming and enjoyed the horse ride. The kids milked cows, feed the pigs and cows, enjoyed the chickens, cats, donkeys, the dog and horses. It was an unforgettable experience for the whole group, and we are planing our trip back.

While we didn't take them up on the farm tour exactly, we did have a chance to chat with Kalee (herd manager), Dan and Ashley as well. They were so kind and welcoming. It took every bit of resolve to not hug Ashley when we were leaving. The description doesn't begin to describe what a wonderful experience you will have here. It was a treat to feed the cows and pigs and the plethora of horses was something else. The farm house was pristine and had everything you would need. We slept well and had a blast. I cannot recommend Dan and Ashley's place enough. With little kiddos it was an easy way to spend quality family time together. Cant wait to be back in 2024. We've already shared the listing with at least 4 other families who will absolutely come out.

The kids immediately made themselves at home on the play equipment just outside and with the impressive collection of farm-themed toys in the garage (kids love tractors!), and the adults enjoyed the view of the pastures and beautiful scenery from the porch and hammocks! Every single person in our group made at least one special connection with a particular animal...be it horse, donkey, cow, pig, and/or cat. Dan and Ashley were excellent hosts along with their other employees, who were all present and available on the farm and enthusiastic about answering our questions and sharing their knowledge and work with us! All of this made saying goodbye after just three days a bit difficult for us, but we plan to be back. I can't recommend the Dairy at Wegmueller Farm enough!

Dan and Ashley's farm is a storybook farm with gorgeous scenery, and delightful animals.
We were looking for a house that's on an ACTIVE farm and we couldn't be happier with our choice. The staff is super friendly and offer hands-on experience into farm life from feeding claves to milking cows. There's also a horseback-riding for an extra fee. It's an unbelievable experience and definitely worth it.
The house itself is spacious, clean, and suitable for larger families. There's also a little swing set and hammocks for you to enjoy.
Dan is an excellent communicator both as a host and as a farm tour guide & instructor.
Our entire family loved our time there.

We loved being around and learning about the animals. We took advantage of the farm tour (learned so much about where our food comes from and how to care for animals) and the kids took short pony rides. We especially loved giving the pigs our table scraps and feeding the baby cows. There was a playground out front that kids lived on. The house had everything we needed and was an easy drive into town for some Swiss meals and even some splash pad time. We hope to come back again!

name: Phil
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Our first time here and this almost seemed too good to be true! Beautiful Swiss Brown cows, check. Magnificent horses, check, Playfully Barn cats, check Shetland ponies, Donkeys, and Pigs that will melt your heart? Check, check, and double check!
Dan and Ashley genuinely care not only about their guests but more importantly their animals, their community, and the environment. They are a successful role model for how the small family farm can survive in a corporate-driven economy while educating on what farm-to-table eating could look like, for the betterment of all concerned.
Their new Equine Therapy outreach will be a necessity for victims of trauma to begin healing however, honestly, this farm is a reality check and therapy for all who stay there. Do yourself and your family/friends a favor- stay here for more than 2 nights and reconnect;take in all Dan, Ashley, and their fantastic crew have to offer!

The farm was so peaceful and easy to locate; just a short drive to the main square of Monroe. We would be overjoyed to stay at the farm again in the future!

We will definitely come back when the farm shop is open!

We absolutely loved our stay at Dan and Ashley's farm!! The house was clean, warm and inviting with many thoughtful touches including local treats to try, bathrooms stocked with shampoo and hand made soaps, and wonderful farm fresh eggs left for us in the fridge. There are great places to gather for meals including a lovely deck where we enjoyed some beautiful sunsets. We also found a well stocked kitchen, plenty of towels and linens , and even a highchair pack and play for our littles. Speaking of the kids, they were delighted to find many books and games to enjoy in the house, bikes and bins of toys in the garage, and a wonderful playset in the yard. The house is spacious and set up in a way that allows for large group gatherings but also has plenty of lovely spaces to separate from the group when you want to.
And then there is the farm!!! As soon as you step on the property you can see that it is well kept and the animals are well cared for but when you take the tour included with your stay, you will find out the love and passion that Dan and Ashley have for the place and get a bit of an education as well! Our kids also loved the horseback riding experience. Dan was so kind and patient with the kids and taught them how to treat the animals in the same way.
All in all it was an absolutely wonderful experience. Dan and Ashley are thoughtful, accommodating and responsive hosts. We made fantastic family memories at the farm. I highly recommend Wegmueller farm and we cannot wait to go back!

review_text: Stay at Dan and Ashleyâ€™s! I plan my familyâ€™s annual fall getaway and the past few years, weâ€™ve visited Door County. This time around, we wanted to check out another part of the state. Luckily, I found Dan and Ashleyâ€™s Airbnb! The house easily accommodated our two families (total of 9 people). The beds were so comfortable. But it was the farm that was the highlight! Dan provided a tour on the first day, introducing our family to the calves, pigs and cows, sharing his wisdom and passion for farming. On day two, most of our group (ages 9 to 59!) went out horseback riding with Dan, which was a tremendous experience, culminating in a picturesque ride across the ridge overlooking the farm at sunset. Unforgettable. The next morning, Ashley took us out to bottle feed the calves followed by a milking demonstration with Dan. So fun! Dan and Ashley were tremendously generous with their time, as well as their hospitality. When we opened the fridge, there were a dozen fresh eggs waiting for us, along with a couple bottles of Spotted Cow, locally produced root beer sodas, caramel corn and chocolates. So many fun surprises! I should also mention that in addition to running a dairy farm and interacting with our family, Dan and Ashley were also hosting a pork roast for the community, which they kindly invited us to! We enjoyed our visit to Monroe, but most especially to the farm. My city kids enjoyed every second of our visit. My 9 yo daughter began asking when weâ€™d be back before weâ€™d even left! Huge thanks to Dan and Ashley for a great visit. And, if youâ€™re thinking about staying at the farm, lock it in before someone else does!!

name: Eric
rating_info:

Stayed with kids
review_text:
The hype is real; you will have an amazing weekend at the Wegmueller Dairy Farm. With a group of four kids aged 2-6, we never had to worry about the kids running away or breaking anything. They loved the swingset and all of the toys that are provided in the garage. And come night time, they all sat in the basement watching movies and playing games. Since the firepit is out in front, it made it easy to monitor kids wherever they may be. As a parent what more can you ask for!
As far as the experience overall- if you're reading these reviews, then you're already intrigued to bring friends & family to a working farm. That's step one! Once you're there, the rest is up to you. We spent time each day petting the cows, trying to pet the horses (ha) and generally watching the milking process when Dan and Sam were in the barn. Waking up each morning, sitting on the porch, and watching the horses graze in the field is such a relaxing change of pace. The tour that they provide sheds a lot of light on the Dairy industry and was very informative. You can tell that everyone there is passionate about what they do and why they do it, which makes the entire experience enjoyable.
Quick Tips:
1) Definitely take a hike up the hill to the east, to see a great view of the farm buildings and landscape. There is a picnic table up there to take a break at. Make sure to pack extra drinks for the hike, because you'll want to crack open another one.
2) Save your food scraps for Prof. Paisley. He doesn't like greens. Letting the kids feed the pig is a win-win experience for everyone.
3) Ask for Dan & Ashley's recommendation for brats; you won't be disappointed. Support local business!

After my work day was done, I was able to join the fire pit marshmallow roasting and watching the sunset. As a first responder, my husband thanked me for choosing a place where he was able to enjoy tranquility and nature. Itâ€™s an excellent place to disconnect and reset. We were not disappointed and we loved the additions -- hiking trails, horses, chickens, donkeys, two farm cats, and a pig. Dan and Ashley truly love their farm and conversing with guests on all the details of running a small farm including the importance and value of humane treatment of their animals. I highly recommend the new horse experience, Most of all it's a chance to get away from the hustle and bustle of life in the city. You will love the sound of the cowbells as the cows head to pasture, and again at dusk as your group gets together on the front porch while the pleasant melody or the bells and the stillness of the night blend together punctuated by the occasional neigh or bray from the barn. Thank you Dan and Ashley!

I took my two daughters on a trip to The Dairy and it definitely rates as one of the best Airbnb experiences we've ever had. Dan is incredibly good with the kids and the animals and had a great lesson on the workings of a dairy farm that kept me engaged as well. While it's a working farm and there are people around doing their work, we felt like we owned the farm and had the run of the place, especially in the evening after everyone went home. For the adults, the beds were great and the welcome booklet gave great suggestions for things to do and places to eat in Monroe. A fun thing we discovered by chance was the inside of the courthouse. The courtroom stopped being used as an actual court about 10 years ago or so, but they left it completely intact and the kids can dress up in the judge's robes and use the gavel and conduct a mock trial if they want to.
For the kids, my daughters told me their top 3 highlights were:
1. Horseback riding/lessons
2. Professor Paisley (a very friendly and pettable pig)
3. Feeding the baby calves
I can't recommend this place enough. Dan was incredibly helpful and available to answer all of our questions and make the experience fascinating and enjoyable for all ages.

name: Lee
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2020
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Words won't convey the magic moments and unforgettable experiences we had at the Dairy Farm. This trip was a family vacation we squeezed in before summer ends and virtual school starts up again. Since March, I've been striving to find ways to capitalize on the "new normal", our post pandemic world and lives. I've discovered beauty in many places but this trip to visit Dan and Ashley's farm was by far the highlight of my pandemic perks.
The backdrop of farm country full of beautiful landscape, stunning sunsets, animals who let you in to their home and space without complaint is only the beginning. This stay was packed full of built in experiences:
- Hand milking a cow
- Joining in the twice daily machine milking, hooking up the machines, dipping iodine, mucking the stalls afterwards
- Feeding bottles to the baby calves twice a day, and I'll spoil the surprise and let you know that holding up a 6 pint bottle of milk for a hungry calf is actually hard work! They are strong babies!
- Rub the cows noses (some like to be pet quite a lot!), and learn what the top of a cow's tongue feels like
- Ride Shetland ponies, either walking for new riders or trotting for more experienced riders
- Learn the song chickens sing as they are laying eggs
- Go for a cart ride pulled by a Belgian Draft horse
- Feed horses, either hay via pitch fork or apples and carrot treats
- Q&A with sustainable farmers, asking anything from how much cows weigh and their body temperature, to what typical vet visits look like, to what their business arrangements are for selling their milk and how they plan to grow their business in the future
The farm house we stayed in had ample space for our family of five, and in fact we didn't use all the beds by far. Kitchen was stocked with all the dishes, pots and pans you need for any type of cooking. Many thoughtful extras including local soap, homemade banana bread, local treats including rainbow fudge, and all kinds of things you might need but forgot to pack, like scrub brushes, plastic bags, scissors, scotch tape, and more. Plus kids books, DVDs, puzzles, and a garage full of outdoor kids toys including a ride on tractor.
But perhaps most importantly, Dan and Ashley treated us like family. They allowed us on to their farm not just to visit and observe, but to be by their sides participating in their daily operations as much as we wanted. We also got loads of time and freedom to explore and discover independently.
I can't say enough wonderful things. I'm so thankful we got to live on the farm, experience the day to day of sustainable farming, to ask as many questions as we wanted, to share something truly special as a family. Thank you Dan and Ashley!

review_text: We had two families with 10 people - 4 adults and 6 teens and young adults. We went tubing on the Sugar River and wanted to stay somewhere close by. This place was only 20 minutes away and could accommodate our whole family. I was worried that the kids would get bored, but they loved it! Dan welcomed our family with a tour of the farm. The kids wanted to keep going back to see the animals. There was plenty of space for everyone to spread out and enough room in common areas for all of us. The house had everything you could possibly need. They thought of every little touch. It was also immaculately clean. Which was a plus for me, since I am quite the germaphobe. Any questions I had before and during were immediately answered. We also loved the view from the porch, the hammock, firepit and access to the gas grill for cookouts. We will be back in the fall to see the leaves turn. Thank you so much Dan and Ashley for your amazing hospitality.

review_text: Dan and Ashleyâ€™s farm was absolutely amazing! Our family had not been together in nearly 5 months and it meant so much for us to be able to get together in such a welcoming place. Dan and Ashley were so welcoming and friendly and their communication with us was great. The farm is in a nice quiet location with great space. Being able to interact with the animals was so cool and it just added to our stay. Our 2 year old nephew just loved all of the animals and we never felt that anything was unsafe. The house was spotless and incredibly clean when we checked-in. The house also had anything you could possibly need if you were to forget something. Dan and Ashley even had some free gifts waiting for us in the house which was such a personal touch. We literally felt like we were staying on our own farm. This place is so awesome and it was just the quiet getaway that we needed. We will definitely be coming back to stay here again and we will definitely recommend this place to anyone who needs a quiet getaway. Absolutely amazing hospitality, and we need to support our local farmers!

Dan and Ashley are really wonderful and friendly host, they have worked hard and thought through every minute details for their guest. The home was clean and well stocked including some refrigerated items like condiments, and there was a thoughtful welcome basket with some local products for us to try and enjoy. There was plenty of room for the 8 of us and then some. Our favorite part was learning about the dairy farm. name: Liz
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2019
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
TL; DR: Bring everyone you know here for a weekend of relaxation, hospitality, and education that's a once-in-a-lifetime experience!
To be honest, my parents are farm people; I am not--or so I thought. I reserved the Dairy at Wegmeuller after a neighbor recommended it as a gift to my country-loving parents, with the expectation that my young kids would get a kick out of farm life while I merely survived. AND I AM FOREVER CHANGED. Ashley and Dan were extremely communicative during the booking and preparation stages, and upon doing some homework, I learned that Monroe is a short drive (just over 2 hours ) from Chicago and a totally different area than our over-explored Milwaukee. In fact, it's just 25 minutes from New Glarus, home of charming Swiss stuff galore and, yes, New Glarus Brewing--maker of Spotted Cow. Upon arrival, we were blown away by the cleanliness of the house and the uber-thoughtful (and tasty) local treats our hosts left. The amount of bath products and towels bordered on insane, and the mattress in the master bedroom was the most comfortable bed I've slept in forever. But enough about the house; let's talk about the FARM.
Oh. My. Dairy.
Ashley and Dan are kind, savvy, brilliant business owners who walked me and my family (ages 4 to 71) through their business, allowing us to hand-milk cows, assist with calf feeding, and explaining the industry's many challenges and rewards. It was truly an honor to spend time with them on their family grounds and get to partake in the farm's activities--they even met us (again) on Labor Day to let my kids milk the cows instead of taking a rare morning off. Their commitment to quality and education is something to be commended, and I am so glad that I am my children got to witness it first-hand. Let me tell you, I will NEVER purchase dairy products the same way again, and I cannot wait to return in the near future. I am so appreciative to have met such incredible people doing such incredible work in the most gorgeous setting. Also, my kids have been afraid of dogs foverer, but Zoe and Bruno the Farm Dogs cured them forever, and now we might have to get one. Or maybe suburb cow, if that's a thing?

name: Avi

Stayed with kids
review_text:
The Farm House is really unique. The house is very clean and well appointed. Everything you need is provided in the kitchen, games in the family room, necessities covered in the bathrooms, toys in the garage and even a comfy hammock on the deck. When you want to venture to town, Monroe is charming with all kinds of tasty restaurants to visit and things to do.
The house is just steps from a working dairy farm. What made the trip truly special is that Dan and Ashley are so genuine and warm. They take great care to make the stay personal and customized to what your crew may want. They were welcoming and eager to give us a personal tour of the farm. Our kids were able to feed the young calves, see all parts of the dairy and even help out with chores if desired (sadly ours didn't -- maybe next time!). We even lucked out that a calf was born the morning we left. We were able to come see and pet her and even were able to give her a name.
Dan is extremely generous with his time, knowledgeable and eager to share his experiences both in the dairy business but also all of his other interests too. He is really passionate about having his guests who are interested have an opportunity to learn about the farm. Dan and Ashley have all kinds of plans to offer guests new experiences in the coming months. After a perfect weekend, we look forward to coming back. We will recommend Dan and Ashley's place to all of our friends.

review_text: A group of old friends (two Sconnies and seven folks traveling from Chicago) met up at Dan and Ashleyâ€™s farm on Friday. We arrived to find local treats and a cool home in a hot, muggy day. As the sun set and we enjoyed drinks on the back deck, we heard tinkling noises. Wind chimes? Machinery? Suddenly we saw them - Brown Swiss cows, 50 or so, all heading toward the grass fields as if on parade just for our arrival. Magical. The next morning Ashley gave us a farm tour and we fed the young calves. We spent time exploring Monroe, napping, reading and playing games. Sunday morning a new calf greeted us in the barn, born overnight. The house is beautiful and sparkling clean...a lovely, functional space. I canâ€™t say enough good things about our weekend. Thereâ€™s a reason they are super hosts. Between the hosts, the farmhouse, the cows, the stars and the lightning bugs, youâ€™ll feel like a kid again.
